dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUISE is a waitress in a coffee shop.  She is in her ear thirties, but too old to be doing this.  She is very pret and meticulously groomed, even at the end of her shift. is slamming dirty coffee cups from the counter into a bus tray underneath the counter.  It is making a lot of RACKE which she is oblivious to.  There is COUNTRY MUZAK in the b.g., which she hums along with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THELMA is a housewife.  It's morning and she is slamming  coffee cups from the breakfast table into the kitchen sin which is full of dirty breakfast dishes and some stuff le from last night's dinner which had to "soak".  She is sti in her nightgown.  The TV is ON in the b.g. From the kitchen, we can see an incomplete wallpapering  project going on in the dining room, an obvious "do-it- yourself" attempt by Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise goes to the pay phone and dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone RINGS.  Thelma goes over to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hollering) I got it!   Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at pay phone) I hope you're packed, little  housewife, 'cause we are outta her  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, wait now.  I still have to ask  Darryl if I can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you haven't asked him yet?   For Christ sake, Thelma, is he your  husband or your father?  It's just  two days.  For God's sake, Thelma.   Don't be a child.  Just tell him  you're goin' with me, for cryin' out  loud.  Tell him I'm havin' a nervous  breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma has the phone tucked under her chin, as she cuts o coupons from the newspaper and pins them on a bulletin bo already covered with them.  We see various recipes torn o from women's magazines along the lines of "101 Ways to Co Pork."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He already thinks you're out of your  mind, Louise, that don't carry much  weight with Darryl.  Are you at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm callin' from the Playboy  Mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma goes through the living room to the bottom of the  stairs and leans on the banister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl!  Honey, you'd better hurry  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARRYL comes trotting down the stairs.  Polyester was mad for this man, and he's dripping in "men's" jewelry.  He  manages a Carpeteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit, Thelma, don't holler like  that!  Haven't I told you I can't  stand it when you holler in the  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Doll, I just didn't want  you to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl is checking himself out in the hall mirror, and it's obvious he likes what he sees.  He exudes over-confi for reasons that never become apparent.  He likes to thin of himself as a real lady killer. He is making imperceptible adjustments to his over-mousse hair.  Thelma watches approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she decides not to  tell him) Have a good day at work today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want anything special for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Thelma, I don't give a shit what  we have for dinner.  I may not even  make it home for dinner.  You know  how Fridays are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny how so many people wanna buy  carpet on a Friday night.  You'd  almost think they's want to forget  about it for the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, it's a good thing you're  not regional manager and I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's finally ready.  He walks to the door and gives Thelm the most perfunctory kiss on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye, honey.  I won't wait up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl leaves.  We see his Corvette parked out front.  As closes the front door, Thelma leans against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma laughs to herself.  She goes back into the kitchen and picks up the phone and dials it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pay phone on the wall RINGS.  ALBERT, a busboy in his 50's, answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.  Why, yes, she is.  Is  this Thelma?  Oh, Thelma, when you  gonna run away with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise comes over and takes the phone out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Albert) Not this weekend, sweetie, she's  runnin' away with me. (into phone) Hi.  What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time are you gonna pick me up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kiddin'!  Alright!  I'll be  there around two or three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of stuff do I bring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Warm stuff, I guess.   It's the mountains.  I guess it gets  cold at night.  I'm just gonna bring  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I will, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And steal Darryl's fishin' stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to fish, Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I, Thelma, but Darryl  does it, how hard can it be?  I'll  see you later.  Be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise pulls out in a green '66 T-Bird in mint condition.

dialogues.speaker: SUITCASE ON BED
dialogues.text: Going into the suitcase is bathing suits, wool socks, fla pajamas, jeans, sweaters, T-shirts, a couple of dresses, too much stuff for a two-day trip.  REVEAL Thelma, standi in front of a closet, trying to decide what else to bring as if she's forgotten something.  The room looks like it decorated entirely from a Sears catalog.  It's really fri

dialogues.speaker: SUITCASE ON BED
dialogues.text: A perfectly ordered suitcase, everything neatly folded an orderly.  Three pairs of underwear, one pair of long  underwear, two pairs of pants, two sweaters, one furry ro one nightgown.  She could be packing for camp. REVEAL Louise.  Her room is as orderly as the suitcase. Everything matches.  It's not quite as frilly as Thelma's but it is of the same ilk.  She is debating whether to ta an extra pair of socks.  She decides not to and closes th suitcase.  She goes to the phone, picks it up and dials. hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  This is Jimmy.  I'm not here  right now, but I'll probably be back  'cause... all my stuff's here.  Leave  a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise slams down the phone.  A framed picture of Louise Jimmy sits on the table next to the phone.  She matter-of factly slams that face down, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is still throwing stuff in, randomly now.  She tal to herself quietly the whole time. She is taking stuff off of her nightstand, a small clock, fingernail scissors, etc. She opens the drawer of her nightstand.  Her attitude is  purposeful; she looks as if she knows exactly what she's  doing; although, frankly, she has no idea, and each decis is completely arbitrary.  As she rifles through it, pluck various items from among the jumbled contents, we see the is a gun in there, one Darryl bought her for protection. is unloaded, but there is a box of bullets.  She picks up the gun like it's a rat by the tail and puts it in her pu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to herself) Psycho killers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the box of bullets and throws them in, too.  Sh tries to close her suitcase, but there is stuff hanging o all over the place.  She stuffs things back in the sides heaves all her weight against the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise's green '66 T-Bird convertible pulls into the driv of Thelma's house.  The garage door goes up and Thelma is standing in the garage with all her gear.  A suitcase tha looks like it might explode, fishing gear, a cooler, a  lantern.  Thelma's car, a beat-up gray Honda, is parked i there, too.  Louise gets out of the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need the lantern.  The place  has electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna take it anyway.  Just in  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case there's some escaped psycho  killer on the loose, who cuts the  electricity off and tries to come in  and kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going along with her) Oh yeah, sure, Thelma, that lantern  will come in real handy.  Maybe we  could tow your car behind, in case  he steals the spark plugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have to.  That thing barely  makes it down the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They load everything into the car.  The trunk barely clos Thelma heaves all her weight against it.  They get into t car and pull out of the driveway.  As they drive down the street, we hear Thelma let out a long howl. She is laughing and she sticks her arms straight up in th air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are driving down the interstate.  Thelma reaches for her purse and finds the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, will you take care of the  gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise shrieks at the sight of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why in hell did you bring that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma wonders if Louise is really that naive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Louise... psycho killers,  bears... snakes!  I just don't know  how to use it.  So will you take  care of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise reaches over and takes the gun out of Thelma's pur and holds it in her hand.  She tests the weight of it, an then puts it under the seat.  Thelma puts the bullets und the seat. They are speeding off down the highway with the RADIO bla Louise puts in a TAPE of wild R&B MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose place is this again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bob's, the day manager's.  He's  gettin' a divorce, so his wife's  gettin' this place, so he's just  lettin' all his friends use it till  he has to turn over the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never had the chance to go out  of town without Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come he let you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I didn't ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, shit, Thelma, he's gonna kill  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he has never let me go.  He  never lets me do one goddamn thing  that's any fun.  All he wants me to  do is hang around the house the whole  time while he's out doing God only  knows what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both silent for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking straight  ahead) I left him a note.  I left him stuff  to microwave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you haven't heard anything  from Jimmy... yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise's jaw tightens.  The car speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge semi-tanker carrying gas passes them on the highwa and HONKS.  The mud flaps are the shiny silhouettes of na women.  There is a bumper sticker on the back that says: "Lick you all over -- ten cents."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is watching herself in the side mirror, pretending smoke a cigarette. THELMA'S POV OF A SIGN alongside the road that reads "See you in church on Sunday!" Thelma pushes in the lighter and waits for it to pop out. Louise gives her a sidelong glance, but does not say anyt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer is it gonna be?  I'm  hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another hour of so.  We've got enough  food for a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never make it... Can't we stop  just for a few minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've not gonna get to the cabin  till after dark as it is, Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what difference does it make if  we stop?  Come on.  I never get to  do stuff like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise realizes that Thelma is going to revert to a teena and continue whining unless she gives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, but it's gonna be a quick  stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull off at a place down on the right all lit up wit neon.  It's called the SILVER BULLET.  The sign flashes  COCKTAILS -- BEER -- DANCING -- FOOD.  There is a huge gr parking lot with lots of pickup trucks and older cars.  E though it's early, you can tell this place is a real nigh spot.  It's already pretty crowded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is jumpin'.  There are ten pool tables with cr all around.  The long bar is filled with customers. There are tables and booths.  The room is dense with smok There is a dance floor, but no one is dancing yet because the band is still setting up.  There are a lot of single  men.  Many heads turn and follow Thelma and Louise to an  empty table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen a place like this  since I left Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITRESS comes over and drops two menus on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all wanna drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have Wild Turkey straight up  and a Coke back, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Waitress leaves:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me somethin'.  Is this my  vacation or isn't it?  I mean, God,  you're as bad as Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just haven't seen you like this in  a while.  I'm used to seeing you  more sedate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've had it up to my ass with  sedate!  You said you and me was  gonna get outta town and, for once,  just really let our hair down.  Well,  darlin,' look out 'cause my hair is  comin' down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Waitress returns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Alright... (to Waitress) I changed my mind.  I'll have a  margarita with and a shot of Cuervo  on the side, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Waitress leaves, a MAN comes over with a chair whi he pulls up to the table and straddles backwards. He is in his late-40's, heavyset, his face is shiny in th neon light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what are a couple of Kewpie dolls  like you doin' in a place like this? LOUISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindin' our own  business, why don't  you try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise kicks Thelma under the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quieter) We just wanted to get somethin' to  eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you come to the right place.   You like chili?  They got good chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress returns with Louise's drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan, are you botherin' these poor  girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no.  I was just bein' friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making eye contact  with Louise) It's a good thing they're not all as  friendly as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name's Harlan?  I got an uncle  named Harlan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?  Is he a funny uncle? 'Cause  if he is, then he and I got somethin'  in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan laughs.  Thelma laughs, too, but doesn't really ge the joke.  Louise does not laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harlan) I don't mean to be rude, but I've  got something I need to talk to my  friend about.  In private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, I understand.  I didn't mean to  bother ya.  It's just hard not to  notice two such pretty ladies as  yourselves. (standing, to Thelma) You better dance with me before you  leave, or I'll never forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.  That'd be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan leaves, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Louise, that wasn't very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you tell when somebody's hittin'  on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what if he was?  It's all your  years of waitin' tables has made you  jaded, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just relax, will ya.  You're  makin' me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma knocks back her shot of Wild Turkey and holds up h glass to the Waitress to bring her another one.  The Wait sees her and nods.  She turns back to face her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Jimmy still hasn't called yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Givin' him a taste of his own  medicine.  Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Louise.  I know you're  all upset.  It's just I'm so excited  to be out of the house, I guess. (pause) I wonder if Darryl's home yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if Jimmy's gotten back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell him to just to  get lost once and for all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ditch that loser husband  of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both drift off momentarily, contemplating their dome problems, until the Waitress comes over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling her eyes) This one's on Harlan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma looks over at the bar where Harlan is grinning at  her, making dancing motions.  She smiles and waves at him Her face becomes serious again as she turns back to Louis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy'll come in off the road, you  won't be there, he'll freak out and  call you a hundred thousand times,  and Sunday night you'll call him  back and, by Monday.  He'll be kissin'  the ground you walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma's mind goes too fast for her mouth, and the speed which she speaks can be staggering.  Louise is used to it Louise smiles wistfully at Thelma's assessment of the  situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, you said we were  gonna have some fun.  So let's have  some!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She again drinks her whole shot of Wild Turkey and holds her glass, as the BAND strikes up a lively tune. Practically the whole place "whoops" and heads for the da floor.  Louise drinks her shot of tequila and holds up he glass, too.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Thelma is dancing with Harlan and has been for quite a wh Louise has been dancing with a quiet guy named DAN.  Thel is breathless, drunk and giggly.  She holds a beer bottle one hand.  She is laughing a lot about nothing, and Harla is studying her closely.  Louise notices this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the noise) Thelma, I'm gonna hit the little  girls' room, and then we gotta hit  the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes closed, swaying  with the music) Ready when you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise heads off to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes still closed) Louise, I'm gonna come with you. (she gets a funny  look on her face) I don't feel so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stumbles a step and drops her beer bottle. Louise is heading towards the bathroom, where there is a  line of at least fifteen women in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching Thelma,  copping feels) Oopsy-doopsy.  We need to get you  some fresh air, little lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steers her towards the door. Louise leans against the wall, waiting in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan is hauling Thelma out the door into the parking lo She is pretty limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress is going over to their table.  She picks up  Thelma's purse off the floor and puts it on her chair. She sets the check on the table, looks around to see if s can see them and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise goes into the bathroom.  She stands in front of th sink and looks at herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma has been sick.  She has Harlan's handkerchief and wiping her mouth.  Harlan has backed off for this part, b he's right back in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feelin' now, darlin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan is leaning close to Thelma's head, and she pulls h head away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm startin' to feel a little  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're startin' to feel pretty  good to me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her to him and tries to put his arms around her. Thelma pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) I think I need to keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise comes out of the bathroom as the next woman goes i She scans the room looking for Thelma.  She doesn't see h She goes over to the table and sees Thelma's stuff there. She picks up the check and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan has led Thelma off to the far end of the parking l He is trying to kiss her now.  He is pushing her arms dow and turning her head away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  I'm married.  I don't feel  good.  I've been sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  I'm married, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan is pushing himself on her now, and she is beginnin to push him away harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is paying the Waitress.  The Waitress is shaking h head, indicating she hasn't seen Thelma either. Louise picks up Thelma's stuff and heads towards the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan has now pinned Thelma against the back of a car an is kissing her neck.  He has her ass in his hands.  He is beginning to hump her.  She is pushing him away as hard a she can, but he is relentless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathing heavily) You're beautiful.  It's okay.  I  won't hurt you.  It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling) Stop it!  Goddamnit, I mean it!   Louise is gonna wonder where I am.   Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is alright.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: is now standing outside the door of the Silver Bullet.  S is looking around.

dialogues.speaker: HARLAN
dialogues.text: is pulling at Thelma's clothes.  Thelma gets one of her a free and hits him hard in the face.  He hits her back and grabs her face, squeezing it hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you hit me!  Don't you fucking  hit me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no trace of friendliness in his face now.  He lo mean and dangerous.  He lets go of her face and pins her  arms behind her.  He holds both of her arms with one hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his free hand, he reaches down and starts to pull he dress up.  Thelma is still struggling and there are tears running down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt me.  Harlan.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns her around, pushing her face down onto the back the car.  He holds both her arms in one hand and continue pulling her dress up over her hips.  He starts to undo hi pants as we hear the CRUNCH of gravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT of the barrel of Thelma's gun being pressed in the nape of Harlan's neck.  Louise's thumb pulls back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let her go, you fat fucking  asshole, or I'm gonna splatter your  ugly face all over this nice car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan slowly raises his hands in the air, and Thelma dar out, pulling her dress down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, calm down.  We were just havin'  a little fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise glances at Thelma.  Thelma shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you've got a real fucked  up idea of fun.  Now turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise starts to back away, but the gun is still close to his face.  His pants are undone in the front.  She is sti backing away with the gun raised.  Thelma is inching away well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for the future, when a woman's  crying like that, she's not having  any fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise lowers the gun and stares at him for a second.  Th she turns and walks away.  Thelma does, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling up his pants) Bitch.  I should have gone ahead and  fucked her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise stops in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said suck my cock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise takes two long strides back towards him, raises th gun and FIRES a bullet into his face.  We hear his body H the gravel parking lot.  LOUISE'S POV.  The car behind hi is splattered with blood.  Thelma and Louise are both sil We hear the SOUND of the nightclub in the distance.  Loui lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!  Louise, you shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma runs to get the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to herself) You watch your mouth, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma comes careening up in reverse.  Louise hops in and Thelma PEELS OUT, spraying gravel.  As they speed out of parking lot back to the road, we hear MUSIC blaring from nightclub.  They hit the main road with tires SQUEALING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back to the interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise lifts her hand and notices she is still holding th gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  I... I, which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West.  Left.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: They get onto the interstate going west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise picks up the handkerchief from the car seat and wi the gun off.  Her movements are as if in slow motion.  Sh puts the gun under the seat.  Thelma is watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise.  Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking) I don't know, Thelma!  I don't know!   Just shut up a minute so I can think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma starts to cry quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we go to the cops?  I mean,  I think we should tell the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them what?!  What, Thelma?   What do you think we should tell  them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Just tell 'em what  happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of it.  That he tried to rape  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only about a hundred people saw you  cheek to goddamn cheek with him all  night, Thelma!  Who's gonna believe  that?!  We just don't live in that  kind of world.  Pull over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma pulls off to the side of the road.  Louise gets ou and starts to walk around the car.  She stops when she ge to the back of the car, and she is sick.  Thelma waits in the car and moves over to the passenger side.  Louise get in the driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise... Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise rests her head on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. (to Thelma) Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma doesn't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma looks at her blankly, without answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta stop for a minute.  I've  got to get it together.  I'm gonna  find a place to get a cup of coffee  and I'm gonna sit down for a second.   Do you want to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma's head moves almost imperceptibly.  Louise studies Thelma's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that yes?  Are you up to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Thelma slightly moves her head in a nod.  Louise p the car in gear and pulls OUT OF SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The green '66 T-Bird pulls into a modern truck stop and p Louise turns to Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta be inconspicuous.  Do you  know what that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you don't talk to anybody.   You don't draw attention to yourself  in any way.  Do you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, she twitches more than nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma nods more firmly now.  She understands. VARIOUS POV SHOTS of truck drivers seeing Thelma and Loui wind their way towards the restaurant portion of the coff shop.  They look small and incongruous with the surroundi INT.  TRUCK STOP - TIGHT SHOT - WAITRESS' HANDS - 4 A.M. slamming dirty coffee cups from the counter into a bus tr underneath the counter.  REVEAL Louise and Thelma sitting the counter.  Louise is looking at a map.  The car is par outside, near the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (halfway to herself) We have to think this through.  We  have to be smart.  Now is not the  time to panic.  If we panic now,  we're done for.  Nobody saw it.   Nobody knows it was us.  We're still  okay.  Now all we have to do is just  figure out our next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our next move?  I'll say one thing,  Louise.  This is some vacation.  I  sure am having a good time.  This is  real fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you weren't so concerned with  having a good time, we wouldn't be  here right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means shut up, Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is all my fault, is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at Thelma for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress comes and fills their coffee cups. Thelma stands up to go to the bathroom.  She grabs her pu from the counter, and the strap catches on her coffee cup and it falls to the floor with a CRASH.  All heads turn a look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to the bathroom.  I...   Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on Louise. EXT.  SILVER BULLET PARKING LOT - 4:00 A.M. Police cars are parked around.  The activity has died dow Doors on the coroner's van SLAM shut.  In the back of a p car sits the Waitress with the door open.  A DETECTIVE in suit leans over the car door with his note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you identify 'em, if ya saw  'em again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, I've told you about twenty times,  yes, I could identify 'em, but neither  one of them was the type to pull  something like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're not exactly an expert  witness, but what makes you so sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If waitin' tables in a bar don't  make you an expert on human nature,  then nothin' will, and I could've  told you that Harlan Puckett would  end up buyin' it in a parkin' lot.   I'm just surprised it didn't happen  before now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anybody asked his wife?  She's  the one I hope did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lena, just cut the bullshit, will  ya?  Do have any ideas or don't ya?   I been standin' in this stupid parkin'  lot all goddamn night, and I still  got to go file a report before I can  go home in time to get back up again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if I had to guess, I'd say it  was some ol' gal, some ol' gal's  husband.  But it wasn't either one  of those two.  The tall one, the  redhead, she left me a huge tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't happen to notice what  kind of car they were driving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a nightclub, not a drive-in,  Hal.  I don't follow the customers  to the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Lena.  Go on home.  We might  have to call you in for some more  questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lena gets out of the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those girls are not the murderous  type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the bathroom there is a pay phone.  Thelma picks up and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Collect from Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone RINGS. VARIOUS SHOTS of the interior of the empty Dickinson hous

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: exactly as Thelma left it.  The drawer of the nightstand  still open.

dialogues.speaker: THE NOTE TO DARRYL
dialogues.text: taped to the refrigerator.  The interior of the microwave with a now completely thawed microwave dinner still in th package in a little puddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  I'll try later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and goes into the bathroom.  As the door clo behind her, Louise comes up with a handful of change and  starts putting it into the phone.  She dials a number.  I RINGS for a long time.  She hangs up and goes into the  bathroom.  She looks at herself in the mirror. She notices a tiny speck on her cheek.  She takes a paper towel and wets it and rubs the spot.  She looks at the to and there is a bright red streak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma... Come on, Thelma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the stall flies open and Thelma comes chargin out and heads straight for the door, without even looking Louise.  Louise charges out after her.  They head out of restaurant and, THROUGH THE WINDOW, we see them get into car and drive away.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The T-Bird barrels down a fairly empty four-lane highway. A truck passes going the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top is down on the car, and Thelma is slouched on the seat, her hair blowing wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna go to the next town and  stop.  We'll get a motel room.  I  can rest for a while and then figure  out how to get some money.  We're  gonna need money.  Thelma.  How much  money do you have with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Oh, I don't know.  Let me  look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is rummaging through her purse.  She finds her wal and takes it out.  Thelma finds some bills stuffed in the change compartment and takes them out.  She straightens t money out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty-four dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she is counting it, one of the bills flies out of her  hands.  Thelma's not that good at handling money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm.  Shit.  Forty-four dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise has not noticed any of this.  She is so intent on driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cash poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.  We gotta get some money.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The motel is near farms and agricultural areas with crops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains are open and we can see the car parked right outside the room.  Thelma is lying on the bed staring up the ceiling.  Louise is bustling around the room, putting things in drawers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you unpacking?  You said we  were just gonna take a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise did not realize she was doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know.  I'm just nervous.   I gotta figure out what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you figure it out, wake  me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what the hell is wrong with  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise slams the closet door.  Thelma jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you actin' like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actin' like what?!  How am I supposed  to act?  'Scuse me for not knowing  what to do after you blow somebody's  head off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could help me try and figure it  out!  I gotta figure out what to do,  and you could try and help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggested we go to the police, but  you didn't like that; so, frankly,  Louise, I'm all out of ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's the big rush, Thelma?   If we just give 'em some time, they'll  come to us...!  Oh Christ.  I'm just  not ready to go to jail yet.  Why  don't you go out to the pool or  something and I'll figure it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not touchin' that car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stuff's in the trunk!  God!  You  care more about that car than you do  about most people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people just cause me trouble,  but that car always gets me out of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is at the police station where they're dusting the ca with Harlan all over it for prints.  Hal looks closely at the back of the car.  He holds his hands over two sets of hand prints.  He moves his hands to the outside of the pr so as not to smear them, and puts his hands on the car. face is one inch away from the trunk.  He sees a very cle drop of blood.  It's different than any of the other bloo splatters on the car.  He calls the identification techni over and points it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The I.D. TECH comes over and looks and shrugs his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His, I guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal makes a face like he suddenly felt a slight toothache He stares at the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal takes out a black sharpie and draws a circle around t area of the black smudge and the drop of blood.  He shake his head slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma comes out of the room and walks towards the pool. She stops, then decides to go on to the pool.  She lies d in a lounge chair facing the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise in the motel room.  She's looking at the phone.  S picks it up and dials it and watches herself in the mirro She stares as if she's trying to see into herself, see th herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma arranges herself in a lounge chair, trying despera to feel like she's on vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  This is Jimmy.  I'm not here  right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE interrupts the message:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!  I'm here.  Hang on a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine switches OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIMMY, mid-30's, musician, is standing in the kitchen on phone.  He's not the type you'd expect Louise to like, no quite straight-looking enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Jimmy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is looking at herself on the phone in the mirror. She is very choked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Louise!  Where are you?  Are you  alright?  Honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  I'm okay.  How are you?  Long  time no see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, honey... Where are you?  You  sound funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is still looking at herself in the mirror, as if s never seen herself before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am funny.  I'm real funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in town?  This sounds long  distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm out of town.  I'm in... I'm  in real deep shit, Jimmy.  Deep shit  Arkansas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, just tell me what the hell  is going on here!  I come back, nobody  knows where you are.  Is Thelma with  you?  Darryl's been callin' here  every half-hour sayin' he's gonna  kill you both when you get back,  he's goin' nuts.  I don't envy her  if she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma at pool basking in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Where'd y'all go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishing.  Look, Jimmy... I need you  to help me.  This is serious.  I'm  in trouble and I need you to help  me.  Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is shocked by the gravity of her tone of voice.  He realizes this is very serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, darlin'.  I can help you.   Tell me where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise covers the mouthpiece with her hand.  She is tryin very hard not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a savings account with about  sixty-seven hundred dollars in it.   Now I know you won't be able to get  it out, but I'm good for it.  I need  that money.  Can you wire me the  sixty-seven hundred dollars and I'll  pay you back?  Please, I'm desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something real bad has happened and  I can't tell you what, just that  it's bad and I did it and I can't  undo it.  Can you help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Of course!  Where?  Can't  I bring it to you?  For God's sake,  baby, please, just tell me what's  happened, what could possibly be so  bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise sits on the edge of the bed.  She is looking at he hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the ring that she wears on her left hand and tu it around backwards to make it look like a wedding band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, sure... yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wire it to the Western Union in  Oklahoma City,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in Oklahoma?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, let me call you back after I  wire it, so you'll know which office  to go to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't it go to any office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, for that much money I have to  tell them exactly which office.  I  know, I've had to have money wired  to me on the road.  And there has to  be a code word or they won't give it  to you.  I'll have to tell you the  code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'll call you back.  In an  hour.  Don't tell Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Call me back.  Louise, I  love you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma by the pool.  A car SCREECHES, a loud horn HONKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellowing) Come on, Thelma!  Get in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma bolts upright and grabs her sundress and dashes to the car.  She jumps in over the door.  She's in a mild st of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you finish thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think better when I drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise PEELS OUT of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is in the office talking to his superior.  He stands front of the desk with his hands in his pockets while his MAJOR sits behind the desk looking troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we know is there were two women  in a green T-Bird convertible that  turned left out of the parking lot,  going real fast.  We're trying to  get a make on the car, but nothin'  yet.  So far, we got nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'd best get something.   Even if they didn't do it, it times  out that they most likely witnessed  it.  I want somebody to at least  talk to 'em.  Put out an APB with a  description and see what we get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any reason to believe they've  left the state?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's certainly possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we go ahead and let the  bureau in on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no problem with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's butt is gonna bar-b-que.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get mad, Louise, but where are  we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oklahoma City.  Jimmy's gonna wire  me some money, and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to him?!  Is he mad?  Did  you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't tell him.  And that's  something we gotta get straight.   Darryl's been callin', mad as a  hornet, makin' all kinds of noise.   When you talk to him, you cannot say  anything about this.  You gotta make  sure everything sounds normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called the asshole at 4:00 in the  morning and he wasn't even home.  I  don't know what he's got to be mad  about.  I'm the one who should be  mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been tellin' you that for the  last ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think Darryl's having an  affair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Darryl is mature enough  to conduct an affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you think he fools around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma, I'm going to Mexico.  I think  I can make it in two and a half days,  but I'm going to have to haul ass.   Are you up to this?  I mean, I have  to know.  This isn't a game.  I'm in  deep shit.  I gotta know what you're  gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't know.  I don't know  what you're askin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you fall apart on me.   Goddamnit, Thelma.  Every time we  get in trouble, you go blank or plead  insanity or some such shit, and this  time... Not this time.  Everything's  changed now... Now you can do whatever  you want, but I'm going to Mexico.   I'm going.  Are you coming with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is staring down the road.  She does not answer.  T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he does.  Fool around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT of an "indent-a-kit" likeness of Louise.  On a table nearby lies a drawing strongly resembling Thelma. Lena, the waitress, sits next to the plain-clothes cop wh holds the indent-a-kit.  Hal picks up the drawing and stu it closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The T-Bird rolls into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma pull up in front of an old store, the k with a wooden front porch, the kind that sells bait and  flannel shirts.  They enter the store and see an OLD MAN  behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a pay phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Round the side, by the restrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise gets change while Thelma strolls around looking at rubber worms and pickled pigs' feet.  Louise goes out to phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise dropping change into the phone.  It RINGS and Jimm answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how you answer the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) I got it.  I was afraid I'd missed  you.  I almost couldn't get a check  cashed.  It's Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of mine, owns a club.  Dickie  Randall.  You'd know him if you saw  him.  His brother was in your class.   Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't say what it was for, did  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) No, honey.  I told him I was buyin'  a car.  What is it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not responding to  the question) Good.  That was good.  Where do I  go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) It's a place called Shaw's Siesta  Motel.  The address is 1921 North  East 23.  It's under your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's the mysterious code word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the code word.  I miss you,  peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise rolls her eyes and tries not to melt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jimmy.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her finger down on the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is still holding the phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma in store buying gum, beef jerky.  Next to the cash register on the counter on display are those little tiny  bottles of liquor.  Thelma picks up a little bottle of Wi Turkey and puts in on the counter.  The Old Man rings it She takes another one and puts it on the counter. The Old Man is still ringing stuff up. She takes two more and puts them on the counter.  She tak the rest of the little bottles of Wild Turkey out of the  display and puts them on the counter.  She takes one litt bottle of Cuervo and puts it down on the counter, too.  T Old Man finally looks at her.  From the wall behind him, takes a pint of Wild Turkey down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, are you sure you wouldn't  rather have the large economy size?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is hanging up the phone.  She walks away towards t front of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma comes out of the front of the store.  The store is a crossroads with a fair amount of vehicular traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go call Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is walking towards the car.  She puts her purse in the front seat.  She looks at Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him.  Don't tell him anything.   Tell him you're having a wonderful  time and you'll be home tomorrow  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I won't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma and Louise look at each other while this sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: THELMA
dialogues.text: walks around to the side of the building to the phone.  S picks it up and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Collect from Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise goes into the store for a chocolate Yoohoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl in the den of their house.  The room is a mess. There are beer cans everywhere.  The large screen TV is O showing a FOOTBALL GAME.  Darryl is in a recliner.  He is wearing loud shorts, a V-necked T-shirt, and a couple of  necklaces and bracelets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Thelma, where in the Sam  Hill are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... I'm with Louise.  We're in  the mountains, we're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) What in the hell do you think you're  doing?  Have you lost your goddamn  mind?!  Is that it?  I leave for  work and you take complete leave of  your senses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl... baby... Darryl, calm down  now, honey.  Please don't get so  mad.  I can explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl is mad, but he's still watching the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.  Hold on a minute, damnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He covers the mouthpiece and watches a play where "his te fumbles the ball.  This only makes him madder.  He puts t phone back to his ear in time to hear Thelma say:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...only for one day and we'll be  back tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you won't.  You'll be back today.   Now!  You get your ass back here,  Thelma, now, Goddamnit.  Thelma, do  you understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is trying not to cry.  She's trying to be strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl, please... You're my husband,  not my father, Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) That does it!  That Louise is nothin'  but a bad influence.  If you're not  back here tonight, Goddamnit,  Thelma... well, I just don't wanna  say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither one of them say anything for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma has tears running down her face and she is watchin the ground as she storms back to the car.  So she makes a loud grunt as she slams into someone that she did not see Both people are knocked back a few steps from the force o the collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!  Excuse me!  Miss, are you  alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma nods her head "yes," but tears continue.  Her cryi is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma shakes her head "no." She tries to control her tea She notices how blue his eyes are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Thanks.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: THELMA
dialogues.text: collects herself as she walks back to the car.  She gets and is drying her eyes, looking in the side mirror.  In t mirror she sees the Hitchhiker come back around from the  side of the building.  He is several feet behind the car, and she watches him as he removes his long-sleeved shirt stuffs it into his duffel bag.  Now he is just in T-shirt and jeans.  He looks good.  Really good.  She watches in mirror as he picks up his stuff and heads towards the roa She can see him as he's walking.  He stops.  He's thinkin He heads over to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind me asking which  direction you and your friend are  going?  I'm trying to get back to  school and my ride fell through, so  I'm kinda stuck.  Are you going my  way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm.  I think we're going to Oklahoma  City.  But I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you could... I mean, I  could help pay for gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma knows Louise isn't going to like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm.  Well, see, it's not really up  to me.  It's not my car.  Umm, we'll  have to ask my friend, but she'll  probably say no.  She's a little  uptight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Maybe we better not ask her.   But thank you anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she wants him to come.  He starts to walk away from t car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can ask her.  That won't  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Louise comes out of the store.  She sees Thelma talking to this guy and, for one moment, stops dead in he tracks as she takes this in, then continues toward the ca Although her face is basically expressionless, we see tha it's possible she might kill Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, this young man is on his way  back to school and needs a ride, and  I thought since...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hitchhiker just nods and starts walking towards the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all have a nice day.  Drive safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy does seem really nice and Thelma is really frustr that Louise wouldn't give him a ride, but decides not to  confront her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how polite he is?  He was really  nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise lowers the top and backs the car out.  They watch walk away. Louise pulls out of the parking lot onto the road.  They  pass the Hitchhiker.  Thelma waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thelma) You cheer up now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around in the seat to continue waving.  He smil and waves.  They drive down the road.  TIGHT SHOT of the  Hitchhiker as the smile fades from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma looking sulky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish we could've brought him with  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Darryl say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) He said "Okay, Thelma.  I just wanted  to know you were alright.  I hope  you're havin' a good time.  You sure  deserve one after puttin' up with me  all the time.  I love you, honey."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long before we're in Goddamn  Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal goes over a list of every registered green T-Bird in state.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER MONITOR
dialogues.text: Names are scrolling by as Hal stares blankly at the scree We see the name LOUISE ELIZABETH SAWYER scroll past.  It  means nothing to Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's twenty minutes later.  They are clear of the town.   Thelma is like a dog with a bone.  She just won't let it  drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't see what it would hurt  just to give somebody a ride.  Did  you see his butt?  Darryl doesn't  have a cute butt.  You could park a  car in the shadow of his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I'm just not in the mood  for company right now.  Here.  Take  this map.  I need you to find all  the secondary roads to Mexico from  Oklahoma City.  I think we should  stay off the interstates.  We're too  conspicuous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking map) Well, it looks like we can get on  this road 81 that heads down towards  Dallas, then cut over to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I don't want to go that way.  Find a  way that we don't have to go through  Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at map) Wait.  What?  You want to go to Mexico  from Oklahoma and you don't want to  go through Texas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I feel about Texas...   We're not going that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Louise, but we're running  for our lives!  Don't you think you  could make an exception just this  once?!  I mean, look at the map.   The only thing between Oklahoma and  Mexico is Texas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma!  I'm not gonna talk about  this!  Now find another way or give  me the goddamn map and I will!  You  understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Louise.  How come you never said  what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is completely unreasonable on this subject and The is totally puzzled by Louise's reaction but is reluctant press her further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I just... I just don't think  it's the place I wanna get caught  for doin' something like... if you  blow a guy's head off with his pants  down, believe me, Texas is the last  place you wanna get caught!  Trust  me!  Now, I said, I don't wanna talk  about it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks very shaken up.  She keeps her eyes on the r but she's holding the steering wheel so tightly, her knuc are white.  She does not look at Thelma.  Suddenly she re over and locks her door.  Thelma flinches imperceptibly a this gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  We'll go around Texas to get  to Mexico.  This is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Harley-Davidson bikes tool past, driven by a couple o ex-hippies from the 60's.  The Hitchhiker is on the back one, and he waves to them as they go by.  Thelma waves ba enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what.  He is gooood  lookin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise pops a TAPE into the cassette player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal walks up the sidewalk past a couple of elderly people sitting outside, to the door of an apartment complex and  knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS of Louise's empty apartment. There are pictures of Louise and Thelma in high school. The kitchen is spotless and nothing is out on the counter

dialogues.speaker: HER BED
dialogues.text: is unwrinkled, perfect, and next to it on her nightstand a picture of Jimmy and her in a small heart shaped frame. Everything is extremely neat and orderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is walking back down the sidewalk past the old people He stops, turns around and goes back to them.  We see him stand and talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma and Louise are singing along with the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitchhiker standing on the side of the road.  Thelma look at Louise pleadingly.  Louise's car pulls over and he hop in the back seat.  An animated Thelma turns around backwa in the front seat to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal walks into the coffee shop where Louise works.  VARIO SHOTS of him talking to other employees.  Albert, waitres etc.  Some cover their mouths as they recognize police  sketches of Louise and Thelma.  The Day Manager comes ove looks at the pictures and talks to Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma passing out beef jerky and Wild Turkey to Hitchhik and Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal's unmarked detective car pulls up in front of Thelma' house.  A Corvette, completely customized with everything sits in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitchhiker leans over resting his chin on the back of the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So J.D., what are you studying in  school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human nature.  I'm majoring in  behavioral science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And whaddya wanna be when ya grow  up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise laughs.  He has charmed her too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is walking up the sidewalk as the front door flies op to reveal a drunk Darryl in Hawaiian shorts, necklaces an beer can in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and Darryl in den.  The TV DRONES in the b.g. Pictures and papers are on the table.  TIGHT SHOT of Darr face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSEUP of Darryl's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thelma) So how come you don't have any kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl, that's my husband, he says  he's not ready.  He's still too much  of a kid himself.  He prides himself  on being infantile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a lot to be proud of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Darryl don't get along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's puttin' it mildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks he's a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a real piece o' work.  I wish  you could meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get married real young?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four isn't young.  I'd already  been goin' out with him ten years  when we got married.  I've never  been with anybody but Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you don't mind me sayin'  so, he sounds like a real asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  He is an asshole.  Most  of the time I just let it slide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. is looking down the road, way off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better slow down.  That's a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks down the road and sees a highway patrol car  coming down the road towards them.  She does not look ala but veers off the road into a "rest area" drive that has  trees and shrubs that obscure the view from the road. She glides along as the cop car passes on the other side  without seeing them. Louise glides right back onto the road as if nothing unus has happened at all.  They realize they have not been spo J.D. and Louise look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you got a few too many parking  tickets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take you on to Oklahoma City,  then you'd best be on your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is on the phone to the FBI man.  Darryl is sitting on chair looking dazed.  Other law enforcement types roam ar the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prints on the trunk of the car  match those of Thelma Dickinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX STRATTON, an FBI MAN in his early forties, is looking the ident-a-kit drawings of Louise and Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'll be damned.  Isn't that  strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the husband says a gun is missing.   She took a lot of stuff.  It looks  like she maybe planned on being gone  a while.  The strange thing is, her  husband said she would never touch  that gun.  He got it for her 'cause  he's out late a lot, but he said  she'd never touch it, wouldn't learn  to shoot it, just left it in a drawer  for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of gun was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're lookin'.  They were on their  way to some guy's cabin and they  never showed up.  We're lookin'.  We  hope you're lookin' too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The T-Bird barrels down the road at high speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, Thelma, and J.D. pull into the motel parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just gotta run in for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at J.D. in the back seat and takes the keys of the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two better go on and say your  goodbyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise gets out of the car and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older WOMAN behind the counter is looking at a compute screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise Elizabeth Sawyer.  Are you  sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.  Nothin' came in today at  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise turns and sees Thelma crawl over into the back sea with J.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing under peaches?  Check again  under peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, nothin' under peaches neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN comes up behind Louise and stands close behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say Peaches?!  Why that's  the secret word!  Show her what she's  won, Don.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops an envelope in front of her.  Louise is startled and turns around quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  Jimmy!  You... Oh my  God!  What are you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Woman) Can we get another room?  Just put  it on my credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman hands them a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Round to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Jimmy walk outside and catch Thelma sitting ve close to J.D.  Thelma sees Jimmy and is so startled she  screams and involuntarily slams herself across the back s to the other side of the car.  She tries to look nonchala

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy!  Hello, stranger.  What in  the world are you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me no questions, I'll tell you  no lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good answer.  Same goes double for  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. is climbing out of the car, looking very uncomfortab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is J.D.  He's a student.  We're  just givin' him a ride to... to here.   Louise said we could bring him here  and then he'd have to go.  And that's  what he's doin'.  He's goin'.  Aren't  you, J.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.  Thanks for the ride.  You all  take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly turns and walks away toward the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching him) Yup.  That's him goin'.  I love to  watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jimmy) Thelma kinda took to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thelma) Well, come on, gal, I got you a room.   You can go on in and take a nice  cold shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind me, Jimmy, I'm just a  wild woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A regular outlaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise shoots Thelma a look.  The three of them drive aro to the back of the motel.  Thelma turns and looks at the  road.  J.D. is standing there.  He blows her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop in front of the motel rooms and the three of th climb out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me just go in and freshen up for  a minute.  I need to wash my face,  you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is taking their luggage out of the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honey.  I don't want to rush  you.  I just wanna talk to you and... (whispering) ...be alone with you.  I'll just be  in my room, 115, you just come on  down when you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy helps carry the luggage to Thelma's room.  He stops the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise smiles at him quizzically as if she can't believe  he's acting this way.  He turns on his heel and slinks aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you say about him.   The boy has got it bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always got it bad as long as  I'm running in the other direction.   Don't be fooled, he's no different  than any other guy.  He knows how to  chase and that's it.  Once he's caught  you, he don't know what to do.  So  he runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They close the door to their room.  Louise sets the envel of money on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating envelope) Our future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise gets her purse and starts taking out her makeup. She stands very close to the mirror.  She is putting on l liner.  Thelma is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I'm not gonna tell him a  thing.  The least I can do is not  make him an accessory any more than  he already is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so sweet to that guy, you  really are.  Imagine not wanting to  drag him into this.  He is a lucky  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is still putting on her makeup, making sure it's  perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask him to come!  It's like  I said, Thelma, he just loves the  chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well boy, he's got his work cut out  for him now, don't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a lid on it, Thelma!  It's hard  enough as it is.  Just let me get  this part over with.  Now stay here  and guard the money.  If there's any  problem I'm in room 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't wait up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise turns to face Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
