dialogues.text: You're a vision, Louise, a goddamn  vision of loveliness, you always  are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have another drink, Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining out.  Louise goes to Jimmy's room. Louise knocks on the door to room 115.  The door opens  slightly and one red rose pops out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a falsetto voice) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following eleven roses are held out the door, then Lo is yanked inside and we hear her shriek with LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma has taken a shower and is dressed in cut-offs and shirt.  Her hair is still damp but she looks better than did when she arrived.  Thelma is fixing a drink of Wild T and Diet 7-Up in one of the motel room glasses.  There is KNOCK on the door.  She stops what she is doing and is  completely still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the door) Thelma?  It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma opens the door and there stands J.D., soaking wet  from the rain pouring down behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought I... I know I'm  supposed to be gone, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's kind of looking over towards the road.  He's still  slightly shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not havin' much luck gettin' a  ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices looking past her into the room that Louise isn there.  Thelma just stands there looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I'd better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...!  Um, where ya going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Nowhere.  What are  you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Nothin'.  Took a  shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you wanna use the shower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell he does want to but doesn't want to say so. So instead he just kind of stands there with a reticent g on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  I... where's Louise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's off with Jimmy, that's her  boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's lonely for you, I guess.  I  always think of motel rooms as lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma pretends like she's had a lot of experience with t sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (letting him in the  door) Oh, yes, well, they can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is pouring champagne into Louise's glass.  There ar dozen roses in a vase on the table.  He pours for himself he sits as close to Louise as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, my little coconut, what seems  to be the trouble here?  Tell Daddy  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cringing) Jimmy, my daddy's still alive and it  kind of gives me the creeps when you  do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, just tell me what's the  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise just looks at him for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, I'm not gonna tell ya what  the trouble is.  Someday soon you'll  understand why I can't.  But I won't  tell ya, so don't ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is once again shocked by how serious she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost at a loss for  words) Okay, peaches, okay.  But can I ask  you one thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it have something to do with  another guy?  Are you in love with  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothin' like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Then what?!  What, goddamnit, Louise!   Where the fuck are you going?  Are  you just leaving for fucking ever?   What, did you fuckin' murder somebody  or what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise spills her champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  Stop it, Jimmy, or I'll  leave right now.  I'm not kiddin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming down) Alright, alright.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both take a second to regain their composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just ask you one other thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy pulls a little black box out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you wear this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Louise the box.  She opens it and it is a diamon ring.  Louise is flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you at least see how it fits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy... it's beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't see that one comin', did  ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. is out of the shower standing in front of the mirror wearing only his jeans, the top button of which is still  undone and no shirt.  He has an incredible physique.  He  also has a tattoo on his shoulder of the homemade variety Thelma has gone and bought cheese crackers and peanuts fr a vending machine and is into her second Wild Turkey and Up.  She sits on the bed, watching him in the mirror.  He definitely looks better with his shirt off. She suddenly feels awkward and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise has the engagement ring on her finger.  It's reall beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whaddya think.  I mean... I  could... uh... get a job.  Of some  kind.  I mean you've been tellin' me  that for years, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why now, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is hard for him) 'Cause, Louise.  I don't want to  lose you.  And for some reason I get  the feelin' you're about to split.   Permanently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise doesn't know how to respond.  She struggles for a  reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, we've gone all these years...  we never made it work.  We're not  gonna be able to just... I'm not...   What kind of job, honey?  Can you  see it.  I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy doesn't answer right away.  He's trying to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one... I never made it work.   I just... It's not that I don't love  you.  It's not that.  I just never  thought I'd be thirty-six years old  and I never thought... I don't know  what I thought.  What do you want,  darlin'.  What do you want me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  It doesn't even matter  anymore.  I just want you to be  happy... It's not that I don't love  you either.  But Jimmy, your timing  couldn't be worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy does not really understand why this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you just doin' this to punish  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, the last thing I want is  for you to get punished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma has poured a drink for J.D. who's sitting on the e of the bed.  She walks over and hands it to him and as sh does, he takes the drink with one hand and her hand with other.  He sets the drink down on the nightstand and hold her hand with both of his.  He closely studies her weddin ring.  He suddenly looks up at her and gazes at her just intently.  He slowly shakes his head as he removes her ri as if to say, "This is not right for you.  This isn't goi to work."  He looks at the ring as he moves it through sp finally stopping when the ring is directly over his drink He drops it in.  He looks back at Thelma and smiles as if say, "There.  Now don't you feel better?"  He smartly kis her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Jimmy are sitting on the edge of the bed. Jimmy has put the ring on her finger and they both are lo at it, as Jimmy holds her hand in his.  They both ponder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. is standing on the dresser with a towel tied around neck like a cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster than a speeding green T-Bird,  able to leap tall babes in a single  bound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps from the dresser and flies across the room landi on the bed, straddling Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in his deep man's  voice) Hi.  Could I interest you in some  Fuller brushes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma has not stopped laughing since he came in the room He is the greatest guy she's ever seen.  He is sniffing h neck like a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling) Stop, stop, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma tries to catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. attacks her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the great and powerful Oz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D.!  Just tell me.  I know you're  not some schoolboy.  Now come on,  nobody ever tells me shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just some guy.  A guy whose parole  officer is probably having a shit  fit right about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  Parole officer?  You mean  you're a criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not anymore, Thelma, except  for bustin' parole, I haven't done  one wrong thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did ya do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a robber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bank robber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  I've never robbed a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I robbed a gas station once,  and I robbed a couple of liquor  stores, and some convenience stores.   And that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was just down on my luck and  it seemed like somethin' I was good  at so I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No, I mean how would you do it?  Do  you just sneak in real fast or hide  out till the store closes or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, honey, that would be burglary.   I never got arrested for burglary.   Burglary's for chicken shits.  If  you're gonna rob someone, ya just  have to go right on up to 'em and do  it.  Just take the money.  That's  robbery.  That's a whole 'nother  deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, first you pick your place,  see, then I'd just sit back and watch  it for awhile.  Ya gotta wait for  just the right moment, which is  something you know instinctively,  that can't be taught.  Then I'd waltz  on in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. jumps up and picks up a hair dryer and holds it like gun.  He starts acting it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'd say, "Alright, ladies and  gentlemen, let's see who'll win the  prize for keepin' their cool.  Simon  says everybody lie down on the floor.   If nobody loses their head, then  nobody loses their head.  You sir...  You do the honors.  Just empty that  cash into this bag and you'll have  an amazing story to tell all your  friends.  If not, you'll have a tag  on your toe.  You decide." Then I'd  split.  Simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gosh, you sure gentlemanly about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always believed if done right,  armed robbery doesn't have to be a  totally unpleasant experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God.  You're a real live outlaw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may be the outlaw, but you're the  one stealin' my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And smooth, boy, you are smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kinda the best thing that's  happened to me in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a little angle, you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Jimmy are wrapped in each other's arms, quietl making love.  Through this, Jimmy is ardent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise?  I think you are so damn  beautiful.  I mean that.  I always  have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.  Completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) I think you're beautiful too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE of early morning staff, a truck driver climbing i his cab with a silver thermos, squirrels hopping around o the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT of coffee beginning to drip into an empty coff pot.  Louise and Jimmy are sitting in a booth, both on th same side.  They are both playing with their wedding ring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry darlin'.  I'll say I  never found you.  I'll say anything  you want.  We'll find a way to get  you out of this, whatever it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, Jimmy, did you take a pill  that makes you say all the right  stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm choking on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?  Ummm... Do you want me to  come with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, into each other and Jimmy can se that Louise is already gone.  Louise is really touched th he asked her that but she knows it's impossible.  She is  very kind to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... now... it's probably not such  a good idea right now.  I'll... catch  up with you later, on down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her hand she's been holding the ring in the black box. She puts it on the table and slides it back to him.  He s her, suddenly.  He covers her hand with his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is trying not to seem upset, so he's completely sti A taxi pulls up outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your taxi's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy pulls her to him and kisses her so passionately tha employees in the coffee shop look away.  A cook fans hims with a spatula.  The taxi driver, who can see in, looks a his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy, Louise?  I just want  you to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at her hand and Jimmy's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy, sweetie.  Happy as I can  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy gets up and leaves the coffee shop.  Louise watches him go.  A WAITRESS comes over and fills her coffee cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing he left when he did.  We  thought we were gonna have to put  out a fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress chuckles and the other waitresses do too.  L waves to Jimmy in the back of the cab.  The cab driver wi at her.  She smiles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is totally trashed.  J.D. and Thelma are both as naked and hanging off either side of the bed. J.D. starts to stir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is in bed with is WIFE.  He has to get up.  He is hol his wife in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you could ever shoot  someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you could ever think of  a set of circumstances that would  just cause you to haul off and shoot  someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could shoot your cousin Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's an inconsiderate asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking you seriously, Sarah, a  stranger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, honey.  I guess it  would depend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to picture it) Well, maybe if they were trying to  hurt you or one of the kids.  I'm  sure I could shoot someone if they  tried to hurt one of the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could too.  But... I don't  know why I'm even asking you this.   It's just... we can't place anybody  at the scene but these two gals that  everybody swears is sweet as pie.  I  don't know.  I keep hearing words --  impossible -- inconceivable.  If  just one person would say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey.  Nothing's impossible.  You  just don't shoot someone like that  for no reason.  Maybe he was askin'  for it.  Anyway, somebody's husband  probably got ol' Harlan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what everybody says.  Only  problem is nobody's husband was  unaccounted for that night... Could  you shoot Eddie in the face?  At  point blank range?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) In the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) I gotta go to Little Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is sitting in the booth by herself.  Thelma comes  hurrying by.  She looks disheveled but is grinning like a idiot.  She sees Louise and charges into the coffee shop. Her energy and volume is several notches higher than the  rest of the people in the coffee shop.  There are a coupl more customers in there now.  Thelma slides into the boot seated directly across from Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is shocked by Thelma's appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  It got messed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is studying Thelma closely as Thelma squirms in he seat, barely able to contain herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Why?  Do I seem different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, now that you mention it.  You  seem crazy.  Like you're on drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not on drugs.  But I might  be crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I don't think I wanna hear what you're  gonna tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is just about to shriek when the Waitress comes ov and puts a coffee cup on the table and pours some. Thelma gets a grip on herself for a moment then loses it the Waitress goes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Louise!!!  I can't believe  it!  I just really can't believe it!   I mean... whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is just laughing hysterically.  Louise suddenly  understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Thelma.  Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I finally understand what all  the fuss is about.   This is just a  whole 'nother ball game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma, please get a hold of yourself.   You're making a spectacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Louise, you're supposed to  be my best friend.  You could at  least be a little bit happy for me.   You could at least pretend to be  slightly happy that for once in my  life I have a sexual experience that  isn't completely disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I am happy.  I'm very  happy for you.  I'm glad you had a  good time.  It's about time.  Where  is he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left that guy alone in the room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is getting a bad feeling.  She is already standing putting money on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the money, Thelma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma has forgotten all about the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm... it's on the table.  It's  okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both leaving the restaurant now.  As they hit th door they both break into a full run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run across the parking lot around the back to the ro The door is ajar and no one is in the room.  Louise goes and Thelma stays outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!  I've never been lucky!   Not one time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise comes back outside.  She doesn't say anything.  Sh is stoic, fighting tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  That little sonofabitch burgled  me.  I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise sits down on the sidewalk in front of the room.  T comes and sits beside her.  Neither one says anything for moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise?  Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise... It's okay.  Louise?  I'm  sorry.  I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise has seen the end of the tunnel and there is no lig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not okay, Thelma.  It's  definitely not okay.  None of this  is okay.  What are we going to do  for money?  What are we gonna buy  gas with?  Our good looks?  I mean...  Goddamn, Thelma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise quietly starts to fall apart.  This causes Thelma leap into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Stand up!  Don't you worry  about it.  I'll take care of it.   Just don't you worry about it.  Get  your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is still sitting on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Damnit, get your stuff and  let's get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise slowly gets to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move! (to herself) Jesus Christ, take your damn time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is hauling stuff out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT of rear wheel of green T-Bird LAYING RUBBER ou of the motel parking lot.  Thelma and Louise, both lookin little rougher than we've seen so far, drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, FBI Man, various other police and detective types, p up in front of the house.  The front door swings open and there stands Darryl looking like he's been shot out of a  cannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma pull into a convenience store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police are tapping the phones, dusting for prints, etc.,  while Darryl sits motionless in his recliner with a dull  expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Darryl) As you know, we've tapped your phone.   In the event that she calls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max comes up and joins them as they walk down the hallway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to leave someone here at  the house in the event that she calls  in.  Someone will be here until we  find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The important thing is not to let on  that you know anything.  We want to  try and find out where they are.   Now I don't want to get too personal,  but do you have a good relationship  with your wife?  Are you close with  her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess.  I mean, I'm about as  close as I can be with a nut case  like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if she calls, just be gentle.   Like you're happy to hear from her.   You know, like you really miss her.   Women love that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma and Louise are sitting in the car.  They've put al their money together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty-eight dollars ain't gonna  make a dent, baby girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting out of the  car) Don't worry about it.  You want  anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma marches off to the store.  Louise puts a tape in t deck and is listening to loud R&B MUSIC.  She checks in the rearview mirror.  She takes her lipstick out and i about to put it on.  She makes eye contact with herself a instead, throws it out the window, closes her eyes and le her head back on the seat.  She's in a world of shit. Thelma comes trotting out of the store and jumps into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive!  Drive away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (driving away) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma opens her purse and exposes a bag full of bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  You robbed the store?  You  robbed the Goddamn store?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma shrieks with excitement.  Louise is completely stu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well!  We needed the money!  It's  not like I killed anybody, for God's  sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise shoots her a look.  She puts the car in gear and F it out of the parking lot.  She is still looking at Thelm as if she has completely lost her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  Well, we need the money.   Now we have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, Thelma!!  Shit!  Shit!   Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly) Now you get a grip, Louise!  Just  drive us to Goddamn Mexico, will ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Shit, Thelma!  What'd you do?   I mean, what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, Max, various other cops, and Darryl all watch as TV  plays back VCR TAPE of Thelma in the convenience store pu a gun.  In perfect lip sync is:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, ladies and gentleman, let's  see who'll win the prize for keepin'  their cool.  Everybody lie down on  the floor.  If nobody loses their  head, then nobody loses their head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT of Darryl's face going deeper and deeper into state of shock.  TIGHT SHOTS of Hal, Max, etc., all looki intently at the screen. VIDEO IMAGE of Thelma boldly ordering cashier to fill her purse with money.  As he's loading the purse with bills,  she's taking beef jerky from the display and putting it i there, too, while she points the gun at the cashier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (videotape playback) You, sir... You do the honors.  Just  empty that cash into this bag and  you'll have an amazing story to tell  all your friends.  If not, you'll  have a tag on your toe.  You decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma and Louise in car, driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) My Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise throws the map across the front seat at Thelma and FLOORS it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is entering the apartment building, carrying his  overnight bag.  Two men are sitting on the stairs.  They  stand as he comes in.  They are plainclothes police.  The show their badges.  He leaves with them.

dialogues.speaker: J.D.'S BACKSIDE
dialogues.text: made only more prominent by the bulging wallet in his bac right pocket. J.D. is walking down the road and continues to walk as an Oklahoma State Patrol car pulls up alongside him.  He smi and gives a friendly wave as they cruise along slowly bes him.  We can see the cop nearest him talking, and then we see J.D. stop walking and set down his duffel bag.  He re for his wallet.  It's clear that they have asked for some I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is driving.  They fly past a kid on his bike on a  long gravel driveway.  He watches them.  A huge cloud of  dust blows up as they pass him.  He turns and rides his b down the driveway towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, you'd better slow down.   I'll just die if we get caught over  a speeding ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at the speedometer touching 80 mph and lets foot off the gas.  Louise is looking a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in my life, I  wish this car wasn't green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure we should be driving  like this?  In broad daylight and  everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we shouldn't, but I want to put  some distance between us and the  scene of our last Goddamn crime!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooweee!!  You shoulda seen me!   Like I'd been doin' it all my life!   Nobody would ever believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you've found your calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  Maybe.  The call of the wild!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma howls like a dog and drinks a little bottle of Wil Turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  I believe I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is in a small room with Hal, Max, other cops, looki stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God, she wouldn't tell me  one thing!  Christ!  You oughta try  to find that kid that was with 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some young guy.  Around twenty  years old.  Dark hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is really upset and has to really struggle to contr himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to remember  him) They said they'd picked him up along  the way.  He was a student.  But he  didn't look right.  But he left when  they got to the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand that you may be  facing an accessory charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is serious, son.  A man is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!  I'd tell you if I knew!   Goddamn!  I know something happened,  or she wouldn't have left.  I'm trying  to remember everything!  Find that  fucking kid.  He probably knows  something.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Thelma and Louise are in the car.  Thelma is taking empty little Wild Turkey bottles out of her purse and throwing  them out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the plan, Thelma?  You  just gonna stay drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Litterbug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come ROARING up on a semi-tanker carrying gas.  We s their FISH-EYE REFLECTIONS in the shiny tanker. The mud flaps are the shiny silhouettes of naked women th Thelma and Louise saw earlier.  The truck is going slower than they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, great.  This always happens.   Whenever you're in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She noses out to see if she can pass, but there's a car  coming.  The car passes and the truck HONKS.  The truck  driver's arm comes out his window and waves them past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that nice?  Truck drivers are  always so nice.  The best drivers on  the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they get next to the truck, the truck driver is smilin and waving at them.  They smile and wave back.  He flicks his tongue at them.  Louise screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh!!  Gross!!  Oh my God!  Aw, God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise FLOORS it and speeds past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh!!  Why do they have to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think we like it.  Maybe they  think it turns us on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise shivers with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is looking at police mug shots of a lot of young gu Hal shows Jimmy a mug shot of J.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the guy you saw them with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking closely) It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clapping his hands) Oh, happy day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kiddin' me.  They picked  up a murderer?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed robber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hal) They're flying him here right now.   He was picked up this morning for  parole violation.  They also found  about six grand on him, so he probably  knocked over something while he was  out there.  They can drop him by  here for questioning.  I'm so happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overhearing) How much cash did he have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. arriving, handcuffed, at State Police building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The T-Bird is entering terrain that looks more like deser The top of the T-Bird is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to call Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find out if he knows anything.   If you think he does, you gotta hang  up because it means the police have  told him and the phone is probably  tapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Louise, tapped the phone?  You  think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) Oh, come on!  Murder one and armed  robbery, Thelma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murder one!  God, Louise, can't we  even say it was self-defense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wasn't!  We got away!  We  were walkin' away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know that!  It was just  you and me there.  I'll say he raped  me and you had to shoot him!  I mean,  it's almost the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No physical evidence.  We can't prove  he did it.  We probably can't even  prove he touched you by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both pause for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God.  The law is some tricky shit,  isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know 'bout all this stuff  anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise does not answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, what do we say about the  robbery?  No excuse for that.  No  such thing as justifiable robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Louise!

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: As the sun sets, the T-Bird drives deeper into the vast  desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl is sitting in the hallway.  Two officers are leadi J.D. down the hall. Hal, Max, other plainclothes officers follow.  Darryl loo at Hal questioningly.  Hal doesn't respond and the entour quickly goes into a room.  Darryl stands and crosses the  hall to the room as the door shuts in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at the door) Hey!  Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the nut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Thelma Dickinson's husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl tries the doorknob, but the door is locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, Max, J.D., other officers.  There is a VCR and monit set up in the room and they view the videotape of Thelma the convenience store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased) Alright!  She did good!  Didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, son, she's doin' a damn sight  better 'n you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get $6600.00 in cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We spoke with a gentlemen today who  says he personally delivered very  close to that same amount to a Miss  Louise Sawyer.  Do you know her too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, yes.  She was driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he took it to a motel in  Oklahoma City.  He also says that at  that time he met a man.  He identified  you through a series of mug shots.   He also told us that you and Mrs.  Dickinson seemed "close." Is that  true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might say we had a meeting of  the minds, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that Mrs. Dickinson and  Miss Sawyer are wanted in connection  with a murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did either of them ever indicate  that they might be running from the  Law?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised to hear  this) Now that you mention it, they might  have been a little bit jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?  You're starting to  irritate me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal thinks for a moment and then looks to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I have a word with  him alone for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max agrees and opens the door for the others to leave.  H and Hal make eye contact before Max closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  What'd I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal sits down across the table from J.D. and looks at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, I gotta feelin' about somethin'  and I just wanna ask your opinion.   Do you think Thelma Dickinson would  have committed armed robbery if you  hadn't taken all their money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. doesn't say anything.  They both just sit there for moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat got your tongue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. shifts in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know I took it?  How do  you know they didn't just give it to  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's two girls out there that had  a chance, they had a chance...!  And  you blew it for 'em.  Now they've  gotten in some serious trouble, some  very serious trouble and for at least  part of it, I'm gonna hold you  personally responsible for anything  that happens to them.  I've got no  feelin' for you.  But I may be the  only person in the world who gives a  rat's ass what happens to them and  you're either gonna tell me every  damn thing you know, so there's a  small chance I can actually do them  some good, or I'm gonna be all over  you like a fly on shit for the rest  of your natural life.  Your misery  is gonna be my goddamn mission in  life.  That's a sincere promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal walks over and opens the door and Max and the others  straggle back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, for one thing, you violated  your parole two days out.  And you  know Judge Hainey.  He hates this  sort of thing.  Once he gets wind of  this, he's gonna blow sky high.  And  then when he finds out that you're a  possible accessory to murder and  armed robbery, well, I think we can  safely place your ass back in the  slammer for at least the remaining  eight, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (convinced) Okay.  Is somebody gonna write this  down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl is sitting in the hallway.  Hal comes out of the r first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dickinson, if you'll just hang  on, I want a word with you and then  we'll take you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police officers lead J.D. out of the interrogation room,  down the hallway.  Darryl is watching J.D. closely.  J.D. smirking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slyly, to Darryl) I like your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going after him) Come back here, you little shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and another police officer are restraining Darryl. J.D. is led off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma pull into a gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gas station attendant approaches as Louise and Thelma a getting out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to attendant) Fill her up. (to Thelma) There's a phone right over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma and Louise walk to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding, Thelma.  If you  think he knows, even if you're not  sure, hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV is ON and the place is a mess. Darryl, Hal, Max, and other cops spring into action as th phone RINGS, putting on headsets, turning on tape recorde Darryl picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl.  It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, Max, etc., all are gesticulating wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (real friendly) Thelma!  Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-factly) He knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is very disappointed, taking off their headsets, turning off tape recorders and looking at Darryl like he' an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl still holds the phone in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  All I said was hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma and Louise are staring at each other intently. Louise steps up to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma digs in her bag and hands Louise a roll of quarter Louise gets out of the car and goes to the pay phone.  Th follows her.  She puts the money in and dials.  It RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl, this is Louise.  Are the  police there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again everybody springs into action.  Darryl is fumbling  with the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no!  No, why would any police be  here?  Hey, where are you girls,  anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl gives Hal and Max a look as if he's got it complet under control.  Clever guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to whoever's in charge  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, Louise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal comes over and takes the phone away from Darryl.  Hal looks at Max who nods, "take it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Miss Sawyer.  I'm Hal Slocumbe,  Chief Investigator, Homicide, Arkansas  State Police.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling) I've been better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You girls are in some hot water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're both okay?  Neither one of  you hurt?  You're bein' careful with  that gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  You wanna tell me what  happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Maybe over coffee sometime.   I'll buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know, neither one  of you are charged with murder yet.   You're still just wanted for  questioning.  Although, now, Mrs.   Dickinson's wanted in Oklahoma for  armed robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kiddin'.  Listen, we gotta go.   I'll call you back, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sawyer, I don't think y'all are  gonna make it to Mexico.  We should  talk.  Please.  I wanna to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On hearing this Louise mouths the word "shit" in a very  frustrated way. Louise hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All are busy trying to see if the call was traced.  Darry is back in his recliner still in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is stomping back to the car.  Thelma follows doggedly A moving van pulls in and parks in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That J.D. kid is a little shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise stops as she is about to get in and faces Thelma w standing on the other side of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd they find out we're going to  Mexico, Thelma, how they know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told that thievin' little shit  where we were goin'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise yanks open her car door, gets in and slams the doo and fires up the ENGINE.  Thelma hops in quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told him if he ever gets to  Mexico to look us up.  I asked him  not to tell.  I didn't think he would  tell anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?!  What's he got to lose?   Other than my life's savings, that  is.  Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise careens back onto the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I mean I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise slams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Thelma!  Let me explain  something to you.  Right now we have  only two things goin' for us.  One,  nobody knows where we are, and two,  nobody knows where we're going.   Now, one of our things that was going  for us is gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise stops yelling for a moment groping for self-contro Thelma looks pitiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop talkin' to people, Thelma!   Stop bein' so open!  We're fugitives  now.  Let's behave that way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The T-Bird flashes by on a road that looks a lot like Rou 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise?  Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just past Boise City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idaho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oklahoma, Thelma.  We're crossing  into New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always wanted to see New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car goes streaking by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All's quiet.  The large screen TV is ON and the room is f with dense smoke.  Hal, Max, sit at a table going over  paperwork.  Other plainclothes and surveillance guys play cards.  Darryl sits crumpled in his recliner staring blan at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy sits on his couch with his guitar while two plaincl cops sit reading the paper, doing the crossword puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over music from tape: Thelma is sipping on a little Wild Turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddo we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know, Thelma.  I guess  maybe we could turn ourselves in and  spend our lives trading cigarettes  for mascara so we can look nice when  our families come to visit us on  Saturdays.  Maybe we could have  children with the prison guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not suggestin' that!  I'm not  goin' back.  No matter what happens.   So don't worry about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise speeds up. Thelma hands Louise a little bottle of Wild Turkey and sh drinks it down.  Thelma has one too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you kind of a weird  question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the things in the world that  scare you, what's the worst thing  that scares you the most?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean now or before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I always thought the worst  thing that could happen would be to  end up old and alone in some crummy  apartment with one of those little  dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What little dogs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know those little dogs you see  people with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a Chihuahua?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those, too, but you know those little  hairy ones?  Those flat-faced little  fuckers with those ugly goddamned  teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  You mean Peek-a-poos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Those.  That always put the  fear of God in me.  What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, to be honest, the idea of  getting old with Darryl was kinda  startin' to get to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, look how different he looks  just since high school.  It's bad  enough I have to get old, but doin'  it with Darryl around is only gonna  make it worse. (quieter) I mean, I don't think he's gonna be  very nice about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now, maybe you won't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always lookin' on the bright side,  aren't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are driving through Monument Valley.  The T-Bird spe through the beautifully moonlit desert.  It is almost lik daylight. MONTAGE of silhouettes of cacti, huge rock formations, de beauty SHOTS, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is bright and expansive and the road goes on fore

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh.  It sure is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always wanted to travel.  I just  never got the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you got it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look forward for another moment.  And then, at same time, they look at each other, each taking the other one in completely, in this moment. They're saying everything to each other in this moment, b their expressions don't change and they don't say a word. MUSIC plays on the RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A semi-gas tanker is up ahead on the road.  It looks like the one they saw earlier.  It's got the same mud flaps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!  Look who it is, Thelma.  I'll  be darned.  What's he doin' way out  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise passes him and, as she does, he HONKS.  They look and he is wildly pointing to his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ.  I hate this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have just ignored him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is flying down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are quiet for a moment, then Thelma starts quietly  laughing to herself.  She is trying to stop but cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking with laughter) Nothing.  It's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What's not funny, Thelma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is trying to compose herself but cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but... (she can barely speak) I can't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma isn't making a sound.  She is stuck in a convulsio of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping for air) Harlan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  What about him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the look on his face when you... (she is falling apart  again) ...it's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Now, Thelma, that is not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is still trying to get a grip on herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, he wasn't expectin' that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scolding) Thelma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impersonating Harlan) Suck my dick... Boom!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is laughing wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Thelma.  It's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma has just crossed the line from laughing to crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to catch her  breath) I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both get quiet. Thelma leans back just watching Louise.  She studies her if she's never really seen her before.  All of a sudden a look of shocked realization comes over Thelma's face. She jerks upright and startles Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) It happened to you... didn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise knows what she is talking about.  She becomes  immediately agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it!   Thelma, I'm not kidding!  Don't you  even...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in Texas... didn't it?  That's  what happened... Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks as if she is looking for a way to flee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting hysteria) I'm warning you, Thelma.  You better  drop it right now!  I don't want to  talk about it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Okay, Louise... It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise's eyes are wild, not seeing, while Thelma now seem completely serene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is SCREAMING down the road.  They drive through a little stand of buildings.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: A car speeds up to try and catch them... The red and blue lights pop on.  It is a New Mexico State Patrol car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise sees the lights in the rearview mirror.  LOUISE'S OF THE SPEEDOMETER at 100 mph.  Thelma is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  Thelma, wake up!  Shit!  We're  gettin' pulled over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma jumps awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!  What!  Oh shit!  Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are trying not to panic.  They are slowing down, but still doing 70 mph.  The patrol car is right behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?  What do you want to  do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!  Shit!  Let's just  play it by ear.  He may not know.   He may just give me a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, God, please don't let us get  caught.  Please, please, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise pulls the car off the road.  The patrol car pulls right behind them.  The lights shine brightly in through windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off your engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise does.  The PATROLMAN gets out of his car and appro their car.  He comes to the driver's side window.  It is  rolled up. PATROLMAN'S POV OF LOUISE smiling up at him.  He gestures her to roll her window down.  She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Officer.  Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna let me see your license,  please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise fumbles in her purse for her wallet, opens it and  shows her license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna take it out of your wallet,  please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to slow down.  Hell,  Officer, I told her to slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About how fast was I going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a hundred and ten.  You wanna  step out of the car, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk to the back of the car.  He notes the license p number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna come with me, please?   Walk around and get in the car,  please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as I'm concerned, yes, ma'am,  you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrolman gets in the driver's side.  He picks up a clipb and clips Louise's driver's license to it.  He picks up t hand mike for the radio and, as he does, a hand with a gu comes in his car window.  It's Thelma and she puts the gu to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, I am so sorry about this.   Could you let go of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really, really apologize, but please  put your hands on the steering wheel.   See, if you get on that radio, you're  gonna find out that we're wanted in  two states and probably considered  armed and dangerous, at least I am,  then our whole plan would be shot to  hell.  Louise, take his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise reaches over and takes his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetic) I am really sorry about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, before yesterday, neither  one of us would have ever pulled a  stunt like this.  But if you ever  met my husband, you'd know why I  just can... You wanna step out of  the car, please? (she opens the door  for him) You wanna put your hands on your  head, please?  Louise, shoot the  radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot the radio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise SHOOTS the car radio.  The cop flinches with each  shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police radio, Louise!  Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise fires TWO SHOTS into the police radio.  It BLASTS to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna step to the back of the  car, please.  Louise, bring the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise reaches over and takes the keys.  She takes her li off the clipboard.  She gets out and trots around to the  back of the car. Thelma is holding the gun on the Patrolman.  Suddenly The FIRES the gun, blowing two holes into the trunk cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Louise) Open the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise opens the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patrolman) You wanna step into the trunk, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, please... I got kids... a  wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?  Well, you're lucky.  You be  sweet to 'em.  Especially your wife.   My husband wasn't sweet to me and  look how I turned out.  Now go on,  get in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he's climbing into the trunk, Thelma explains to Louis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all the way in and Louise closes the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma opens the glove compartment.  She takes a box of s ammo and closes it.  Thelma takes the keys and gets out o the car.  She walks around to the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to trunk) Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from her car) Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma hops into the car with Louise.  They look at each  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise pulls the car back onto the road and they drive aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I know it's crazy, Louise, but I  just feel like I've got a knack for  this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVING SHOTS
dialogues.text: They are in really beautiful country now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and Max are alone in the kitchen.  Hal switches on th Mr. Coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just not working like this.  We  gotta do something.  It'd be one  thing if these girls were hardened  criminals, but Jesus, Hal, this is  makin' us look bad.  I don't know...  maybe they're not movin'.  Maybe  that little creep lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got nothin' to gain by lyin'.   Nothin' at all.  He already got all  their money.  I just don't know what  we're dealin' with here.  Anyway, it  went out again last night on  Nationwide Teletype.  Let's just  wait it out a little longer.  She  said she was gonna call back.  Let's  just sit tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a whole lotta choice,  do we?  I can't figure out if they're  real smart or just really, really  lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't matter.  Brains will only  get you so far and luck always runs  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop walks into the kitchen and hands Hal a file that sa Louise Elizabeth Sawyer on the outside.  He opens it up a starts looking through a personal history.  One piece of  paper is a case file from Texas containing an incident re of a rape.  Stamped across it are the words "charges drop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise... are we still going to  Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma pauses while she searches for the logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then aren't we going in the wrong  direction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I figure if you take a state  policeman, shoot up his car, take  his gun and lock him in the trunk,  it's best to just get on out of the  state if you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both quiet for a second.  Louise goes a little  faster. Thelma is digging through her bag.  She hands Louise a pi of beef jerky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see any more beef  jerky.  I mean the next beef jerky  you hand me is going out the window.   It's drivin' me crazy.  The whole  car smells like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good.  It's what the pioneers  ate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what the damn pioneers  ate.  You just keep that shit away  from me, now I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma puts down her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't want any more Wild Turkey,  either.  It's burning a hole in my  stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... I've got some tequila.   You want some tequila?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you want it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma starts to dig through her bag again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is rubbing her face.  She looks pretty bad.  Her h are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  I'm gettin' tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise does not really seem alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've really fucked up.  I  think I've got us in a situation  where we could both get killed.  Why  didn't we just go straight to the  police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why.  You already said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I say again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody would believe us.  We'd still  get in trouble.  We'd still have our  lives ruined.  And you know what  else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy was hurtin' me.  And if you  hadn't come out when you did, he'd a  hurt me a lot worse.  And probably  nothin' woulda happened to him. 'Cause  everybody did see me dancin' with  him all night.  And they woulda made  out like I asked for it.  And my  life woulda been ruined a whole lot  worse than it is now.  At least now  I'm havin' fun.  And I'm not sorry  the son of a bitch is dead.  I'm  only sorry that it was you that did  it and not me.  And if I haven't, I  wanna take this time to thank you,  Louise.  Thank you for savin' my  ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Louise, you said the first part.   I said all the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired) Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is at a pay phone as the sky is just starting to g light.  Thelma is in the bathroom nearby.  Louise has alr dialed and the phone is RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV DRONES on in the b.g. as the phone RINGS there,  everyone leaps into action again.  Max picks up the phone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me speak to... Slocumbe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hal) She wants to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are things goin' out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird.  Got some kind of snowball  effect goin' here or somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still with us though.  You're  somewhere on the face of the earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're not in the middle of  nowhere, but we can see it from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear.  Louise, I almost feel like  I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  You don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gettin' in deeper every moment  you're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you believe me if I told you  this whole thing is an accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do believe you.  That's what I  want everybody to believe.  Trouble  is, it doesn't look like an accident  and you're not here to tell me about  it... I need you to help me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Harlan Puckett...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through clenched teeth, repulsed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come on in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise thinks for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm sorry.  We're gonna have to  charge you with murder.  Now, do you  want to come out of this alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surveillance man motions to Hal to keep it going. Darryl comes in and immediately realizes Hal is talking t Louise.  Darryl looks attentively at Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, certain words and phrases  just keep floating through my mind,  things like incarceration, cavity  search, life imprisonment, death by  electrocution, that sort of thing.   So, come out alive?  I don't know.   Let us think about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, I'll do anything.  I know  what's makin' you run.  I know what  happened to you in Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise's eyes get wide as she hears this. A FINGER reaches up and presses down the lever and hangs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: THELMA
dialogues.text: She has her finger on the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Louise.  Don't blow it.   Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away towards the car.  Louise is still standing there holding the phone.  Thelma stops and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Hal slams down the phone.  He looks over at t surveillance man who nods to say "we got it."  The whole  room reacts excitedly.  Everyone in the room springs into action.  Max immediately picks up the phone and Hal watch him intently.  He mouths the words to Max -- "I wanna go" emphatically.  Max slightly shakes his head, still of the phone.  Hal goes charging over to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max.  You gotta take me there!  I'm...  I'm the only one she's ever talked  to.  I don't want anybody losin'  their heads.  You know what happens.   The volume gets turned way up and  the next thing you know those girls  are gonna get shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, still holding the phone, is surprised by this outbur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Okay, Hal, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is still standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Thelma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna give up on me, are  ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna make some deal with  that guy, are you?  I mean, I just  wanna know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Thelma.  I'm not gonna make any  deals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can understand if you're thinkin'  about it.  I mean, in a way, you've  got something to go back for.  I  mean Jimmy and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise is surprised to be hearing this from Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma, that is not an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know... something's  crossed over in me and I can't go  back.  I mean, I just couldn't live...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I know what you mean.  I  don't wanna end up on the damn Geraldo  Show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both quiet for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said they're charging us with  murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making a face) Eeuww.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we have to decide whether we  want to come out of this dead or  alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, didn't he say anything positive  at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise STARTS the car.  They lurch into reverse then SCRE forward as they tear off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: as they fly down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise, do you think we should change  cars, get another car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... You know how to hotwire a  car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me know when you figure it  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up on an airstrip and stops next to a small j Hal and Max get out of the car and board the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE of driving shots as Louise and Thelma drive throu the intense beauty of the Arizona desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could call it that.  My eyes are  open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.  I feel awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide awake.  I don't remember ever  feelin' this awake.  Everything looks  different.  You know what I mean.  I  know you know what I mean.  Everything  looks new.  Do you feel like that?   Like you've got something to look  forward to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma both get quiet for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be drinkin' margaritas by the  sea, Mamasita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can change our names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can live in a hacienda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna get a job.  I wanna work at  Club Med.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  Yes!  Now what kind of deal do  you think that cop can come up with  to beat that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd have to be pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would have to be pretty damn good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both laughing.  The car is still flying down the road.  The sun is coming higher in the sky now.  They com to an intersection in the middle of nowhere.  Louise stop and looks at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should head a little further in.   There's not that many roads in this  state.  I want to try to hit Mexico  somewhere not so close to New Mexico.   They probably wanna kill us in New  Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drivin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise takes a right turn and speeds down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma are singing along to a wild R&B SON They do the hand movements as if they are the Supremes. They come roaring up on the semi-tanker, the same one the have seen three times before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming over music) Oh my God!  Louise!  Look!  Look!   See if that's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.  He's got California plates.   It's the same guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise bears down really hard and passes him.  Again as t get right next to him, he blows kisses down at them. He is leering at them and laughing.  Louise and Thelma dr further down the road. Louise pulls the car off to the side of the road.  As the truck gets close they start waving to him to stop.
