He pu his truck off the side of the road and stops.  ANGLE ON L and Thelma smiling up at him.  He chuckles to himself.  H leans out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there!  You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine!  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grrrreat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn off onto a dirt road and pull to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trucker reaches over and opens a glove compartment cr full of condoms.  He grabs a few and shoves them in his  pocket.  He turns off his engine and gets out of the truc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up to the car. Louise and Thelma get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been seein' you all along the  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I been seein' you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think you have really bad manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just wonderin' where you  think you get off behavin' like that  to women you don't even know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not what is supposed to be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What are you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know good and damn well what I'm  talkin' about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean really!  That business with  your tongue.  What is that?  That's  disgusting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, oh my God, that other thing,  that pointing to your lap?  What's  that supposed to mean exactly?  Does  that mean pull over, I want to show  you what a big fat slob I am or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean suck my dick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You women are crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think you should apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is getting a little panicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not apologizing for shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you're sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise pulls the gun they stole from the State Patrolman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you're sorry or we'll make you  fuckin' sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably even called us beavers  on your CB radio, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... sure did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.  I hate that!  I hate bein'  called a beaver, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to apologize or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at his truck off in the distance.  She point the gun at it, takes a second to get a bead, then SHOOTS of the tires flat.  The truck slowly sinks as the air esc from the tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh goddamn!!  You bitch!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma look at each other.  They both turn tow the truck and FIRE rounds into the tankers until they EXP in a huge ball of fire.  The truck driver screams at the of his lungs.  Louise starts the car and starts driving i circles around the truck driver.  Thelma and Louise are b howling at the top of their lungs.  Thelma is sitting on back of the front seat with her legs on the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking bitch!  Aaaaaaarrrgghh!!!   You're gonna have to pay for that!!!   I'm gonna make you pay for that!!   You hear me                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise stops the car right next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise takes off again and Thelma falls into the back sea They drive off trailing a huge cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise drives through the desert back towards the road, p the burning debris of the truck.  As she gets to the road she stops.  Thelma climbs into the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Where'd you learn to shoot  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Texas... You were right about what  happened to me there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull away from the burning wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Thelma and Louise talk, their voices are heard over th following scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what's happened, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) We've gone insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered old pickup truck is parked by the New Mexico S Patrol.  An old man uses a crowbar to pry open the trunk. The New Mexico State Patrolman hops out of the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Police Bulletin VOICE OVER BEGINS AND PLAYS OVER followin scenes: A police helicopter flies over the burning wreckage of th fuel truck.  The truck driver is waving his arms as the  helicopter descends, blowing dirt all over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl sits practically comatose in a big chair.  His eye have a dull glaze as he stares first at one wall, then  another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TIGHT SHOT of a TAPE being shoved into the cassette dec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Hal sit next to each other in the jet.  Hal tries appear as if he's used to all this.  Max holds a cellular phone to his ear. TIGHT SHOT of Max as we hear through the phone: Police VOICE OVER becomes part of scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) ...Abducted... shot up the car...  stole the officer's weapon...  tanker... blown up... terrorized...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's face becomes troubled and more serious than we've s so far.  He looks at Hal as he hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not even going to believe  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet banks off to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT of car speeding through the desert on an empty  highway west.  DRIVING SHOT -- Thelma has her face to the sun with her eyes closed.  Louise is driving with a fierc intensity.  They hardly resemble the two women that start out for a weekend in the mountains two days earlier.  Alt their faces are tanned and lined and their hair is blowin wildly there is a sense of serenity that pervades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and Max are climbing out of the jet and running acros the tarmac to a waiting helicopter.  Max is carrying a wa talkie now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma sits up suddenly.  An Arizona police car passes th going eastbound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.  Louise... Do you think he  saw us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but let's get off.

dialogues.speaker: REARVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: The police car cuts across the median to begin pursuit of the girls.  The lights are flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your seat belt on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma puts her seat belt on.  Louise floors the car and streaks off, putting some distance between them and the p car.  Thelma looks back at the police car.  She looks sca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we shoulda made some kinda  plan for what to do if we get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.  We're not gonna get  caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATE POLICEMAN is on his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...requesting assistance.  In pursuit  of a green T-Bird, 1966 license,  seven, one, nine, William, Zebra,  Adam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.  Be advised... (breaks up) ...armed and extremely dangerous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steady stream of state police cars pulls out of the par lot with lights flashing while other policemen are runnin to their cars still parked in the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far are we from Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About two hundred and fifty miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you think that'll take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are now two police cars behind them about half a mi back.  They are going really fast.  A police helicopter  catches up to them and orders them to stop.  Thelma stand and flips them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to Mexico!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back) Uh oh.  There's another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma both are looking back at the two police cars following them.  They turn back around just in time see a third Arizona State police car has pulled into the  middle of an intersection of the only road that crosses i for miles.  They both scream.  Louise swerves just in tim to keep from hitting it broadside.  She goes off the road and has to struggle to pull her car back onto the road,  leaving a huge cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that guy?!  He was right  in the middle of the road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first two police cars are approaching the same  intersection.  They are driving side by side.  There is s a huge cloud of dust that now covers the third car in the middle of the intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge cloud of dust blows across the road as he approach the intersection.  It clears to reveal the third police c in the middle of the road, just as he and police car #2 r the intersection.  ANGLE ON POLICEMAN #1 as he screams an swerves to the right.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: right for him at 120 mph.  He screams and ducks down into the seat.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: swerves to the right.  Police car #2 swerves to the left, both barely missing police car #3. ANOTHER ANGLE as police car #1 and police car #2 both pul back onto the road right next to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Policeman #3 sits up in the seat.  He can't believe he is dead.  He puts his car in gear and takes off down the roa after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in rearview  mirror) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  What d'you think?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma blow through a stand of buildings left  from when the train went through here.  There are two par streets on either side of the one they're on and, as they pass by buildings, they can see police cars ROARING down  these parallel streets trying to "head them off at the pa Louise FLOORS it and her car screams ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We probably shoulda filled up the  car before we blew up that truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll probably catch us when we  have to stop for gas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this whole thing was my fault.   I know it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one thing you oughta  understand by now, Thelma, it's not  your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise... no matter what happens,  I'm glad I came with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise swerves off the road and begins driving across the desert.  All the police cars take off across the desert a them.  They are now being pursued by at least fifteen car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, sweetie, the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I went a little crazy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... You've always been crazy.   This is just the first chance you've  had to really express yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess everything from here on in  is going to be pretty shitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbearable, I'd imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess everything we've got to lose  is already gone anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you stay so positive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does look like an Army.  More police cars have joined, and from every direction, police cars are swarming across the desert, although none are in front of them.  Way off the distance, a helicopter joins the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is looking way up ahead in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the hell is that up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way up ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise strains to see.  Whatever it is, Louise is barreli towards it, the car leaving the ground as they fly throug the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise starts to laugh and cry at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the hell is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Goddamn Grand Canyon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them is a huge wall of dust created by all the pol cars following them.  In front of them, looking larger ev moment, is the awesome splendor of the Grand Canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it beautiful?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's grand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise has tears streaming down her face as she realizes  there is absolutely no escape.  She continues barreling  towards it without slowing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the police cars are still following about a half a mi behind.  The car is bouncing and flying across the desert Finally, they get about twenty yards from the edge and Lo SLAMS on the brakes. Thelma and Louise are just waiting for the cars to catch The police cars stop in a line about two hundred yards be them.  The dust from the cars is blowing across them.  Th just sit looking at the Grand Canyon. From the canyon, the FBI helicopter rises up in front of car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal sees Thelma and Louise for the first time.  They are  sitting in the car, oblivious in a way, to all the activi around them.  He only takes his eyes off of them long eno to look at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God!  It looks like the Army!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma starts to laugh.  Louise is only concerned with mi the cacti and other obstacles that lie before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter lands behind the row of police cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Thelma and Louise facing each other.  They look s nice.  He can't stop looking.  He borrows the binoculars  from Max.  He sees Thelma and Louise in the car.  Some of the police sharpshooters are sporting semi-automatic rifl Hal looks at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Don't let them shoot those  girls.  This is too much.  They got  guns pointed at 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women are armed, Hal.  This is  standard.  Now you stay calm here.   These boys know what they're doin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max climbs out of the chopper.  Hal sits for a moment and then leaps out and follows Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) This is the Arizona Highway Patrol.   You are under arrest.  You are  considered armed and dangerous.  Any  failure to obey any command will be  considered an act of aggression  against us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not giving up, Thelma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's not get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the Grand  Canyon) Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma is smiling at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, look back at the wall of police  cars, and then look back at each other.  They smile.

dialogues.speaker: CARTRIDGES
dialogues.text: being loaded into automatic rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO OF THE ARIZONA COPS by their cars, as they are loadin weapons, talk quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...heard they shot a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his own gun.  Put him in the  trunk and blew him away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise and Thelma are looking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Turn off the engine and place your  hands in the air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is about to crawl out of his skin.  He can't believe  this thing is getting out of control.  He jumps in front Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max!  Let me talk to 'em!  I can't  believe this!  You've gotta do  something here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max goes around Hal and continues walking.  Hal jumps in  front of Max again and blocks his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to bother you, I know you're  real busy right now, but how many  times, Max?  How many times has that  woman gotta be fucked over?  You  could lift one finger and save her  ass and you won't even do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Hal) Get a hold of yourself!  You are way  out of your jurisdiction, now come  on!  Calm down!  Don't make me sorry  I let you come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lets go of Hal's lapels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Shit!  I can't fucking believe this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal walks along with a look of total disbelief on his fac He's shaking his head.  Slowly he breaks into a trot and  starts heading toward the front line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Hey.  Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is running now and clears the front row of cars. There is a lot of confusion among the officers on the fro row.  Some shout, some lower their guns to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the hell?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering his rifle) The son of a bitch is in my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are still looking at each other really hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too, sweetie, the best.

dialogues.speaker: SHOOT WITH OR WITHOUT.
dialogues.text: MUSIC:  B.B. King song entitled "Better Not Look Down" be It is very upbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thelma nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise puts the car in gear and FLOORS it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal's eyes widen for a moment at what he sees, and then a sense of calm overtakes him and he mouths the word "alrig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been around, I've seem some  things, People movin' faster than  the speed of sound, faster than a  speedin' bullet.  People livin' like  Superman, all day and all night.  I  won't say if it's wrong or I won't  say if it's right.  I'm pretty fast  myself.  But I do have some advice  to pass along, right here in the  words to this song...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops all lower their weapons as looks of shock and  disbelief cover their faces.  A cloud of dust blows THROU THE FRAME as the speeding car sails over the edge of the  cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better not look down, if you wanna  keep on flyin'.  Put the hammer down,  keep it full speed ahead.  Better  not look back or you might just wind  up cryin'.  You can keep it movin'  if you don't look down...
